subject: Friday fun ... write a JUnit test, make a buck (or $1.11 to be more precise)
msgSnippet: It s Friday and I am having fun - the geeky sort of work-related fun, that is. I recently discovered Amazon.com s Mechanical Turk and created an account to
messageBody:
It's Friday and I am having "fun" - the geeky sort of work-related
fun, that is.

I recently discovered Amazon.com's Mechanical Turk and created an
account to see how the idea of AAI (Artificial Artificial Intelligence
- i.e. using human beings to work on tasks that computers generally
suck at, like pattern recognition) can be applied to testing
(creating, reviewing, improving, running tests, etc.)

With Mechanical Turk, people get paid for doing the tasks. Payments
range from very small (e.g. $0.01 for deciding if a photo is a good)
to more substantial (e.g. $10.00 for transcribing a podcast).

My first HIT (that stands for Human Intelligence Tasks - Amazon's
terminology) is to ask someone to create a JUnit test that provides
100% statement and conditional coverage for a trivial Java class. I am
offering $1.11 for each test that meets the coverage criteria.

NOTE: I am not allowing people to use JUnit Factory to automatically
generate the tests since we already know what those tests look like.

If you want to have fun with this, I suggest you move quickly because
Amazon.com makes it rather cumbersome to transfer funds to pay for
HITs, so I only have $10 available right now, and until I can put more
money into it, there are only a few hits I can pay for.

To "play" along just go to:

http://www.mturk.com/mturk/welcome

and search for hits containing the keyword: "junit".

Again, this is just for fun at this point...


Alberto

----------
http://www.junitfactory.com
Send it Java. Get back JUnit.
100% free and 100% experimental.
